intro: Dichrostachys unijuga, commonly known as the single-flowered stiltvine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique, elongated inflorescences. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in helical arrangements along the stems. Dichrostachys unijuga is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions. It is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
